columns.name: ARREST_KEY
columns.description: Randomly generated persistent ID for each arrest

columns.name: ARREST_DATE
columns.description: Exact date of arrest for the reported event

columns.name: PD_CD
columns.description: Three digit internal classification code (more granular than Key Code)

columns.name: PD_DESC
columns.description: Description of internal classification corresponding with PD code (more granular than Offense Description)

columns.name: KY_CD
columns.description: Three digit internal classification code (more general category than PD code)

columns.name: OFNS_DESC
columns.description: Description of internal classification corresponding with KY code (more general category than PD description)

columns.name: LAW_CODE
columns.description: Law code charges corresponding to the NYS Penal Law, VTL and other various local laws

columns.name: LAW_CAT_CD
columns.description: Level of offense: felony, misdemeanor, violation

columns.name: ARREST_BORO
columns.description: Borough of arrest. B(Bronx), S(Staten Island), K(Brooklyn), M(Manhattan), Q(Queens)

columns.name: ARREST_PRECINCT
columns.description: Precinct where the arrest occurred

columns.name: JURISDICTION_CODE
columns.description: Jurisdiction responsible for arrest. Jurisdiction codes 0(Patrol), 1(Transit) and 2(Housing) represent NYPD whilst codes 3 and more represent non NYPD jurisdictions

columns.name: AGE_GROUP
columns.description: Perpetrator’s age within a category

columns.name: PERP_SEX
columns.description: Perpetrator’s sex description

columns.name: PERP_RACE
columns.description: Perpetrator’s race description

columns.name: X_COORD_CD
columns.description: Midblock X-coordinate for New York State Plane Coordinate System, Long Island Zone, NAD 83, units feet (FIPS 3104)

columns.name: Y_COORD_CD
columns.description: Midblock Y-coordinate for New York State Plane Coordinate System, Long Island Zone, NAD 83, units feet (FIPS 3104)

columns.name: Latitude
columns.description: Latitude coordinate for Global Coordinate System, WGS 1984, decimal degrees (EPSG 4326)

columns.name: Longitude
columns.description: Longitude coordinate for Global Coordinate System, WGS 1984, decimal degrees (EPSG 4326)

columns.name: Lon_Lat
columns.description: Georeferenced Point Column based on Longitude and Latitude fields

Mayor’s Office of Community Mental Health (OCMH)
Mayor’s Office to End Domestic and Gender-Based Violence
Office of Administrative Trials and Hearings (OATH)

Office of Film, Theatre, and Broadcasting (FILM)

fields.name: Agency

view.description:
List of every arrest in NYC going back to 2006 through the end of the previous calendar year. This is a breakdown of every arrest effected in NYC by the NYPD going back to 2006 through the end of the previous calendar year. This data is manually extracted every quarter and reviewed by the Office of Management Analysis and Planning before being posted on the NYPD website. Each record represents an arrest effected in NYC by the NYPD and includes information about the type of crime, the location and time of enforcement.
In addition, information related to suspect demographics is also included.
This data can be used by the public to explore the nature of police enforcement activity.
Please refer to the attached data footnotes for additional information about this dataset.
view.emailShareUrl: mailto:?subject=NYPD Arrests Data (Historic)&body=Here is a dataset from NYC Open Data that I would like to share with you: https%3A%2F%2Fdata.cityofnewyork.us%2FPublic-Safety%2FNYPD-Arrests-Data-Historic-%2F8h9b-rp9u

coreView.description:
List of every arrest in NYC going back to 2006 through the end of the previous calendar year. This is a breakdown of every arrest effected in NYC by the NYPD going back to 2006 through the end of the previous calendar year. This data is manually extracted every quarter and reviewed by the Office of Management Analysis and Planning before being posted on the NYPD website. Each record represents an arrest effected in NYC by the NYPD and includes information about the type of crime, the location and time of enforcement. 
In addition, information related to suspect demographics is also included. 
This data can be used by the public to explore the nature of police enforcement activity. 
Please refer to the attached data footnotes for additional information about this dataset.

relatedViews.name: NYPD Historic Arrests - Summary Dashboard
relatedViews.description: The following visualizations summarize every arrest effected in NYC by the NYPD going back to 2006 through the end of last year.  This data is updated annually to include the most recent year. Each record represents an arrest effected in NYC by the NYPD and includes information about the type of crime, the location and time of enforcement. In addition, information related to suspect demographics is also included. This data can be used by the public to explore the nature of police enforcement activity.
